definitions.definition: to (cause to) cover, reach, or have an effect on a wider or increasing area:
examples: The fire spread very rapidly because of the strong wind.

definitions.definition: the development or growth of something so that it covers a larger area or affects a larger number of people:
examples: The spread of the disease in the last few years has been alarming.

definitions.definition: the area or range covered by something:
examples: The survey found a wide spread of opinion over the proposed new building.

definitions.definition: a large article or advertisement covering one or more pages in a newspaper or magazine:
examples: There's a double-page spread on the latest fashions.
